sub_title: Senior Software Engineer at Baker Hughes
summary:
Experienced software engineer and tech lead. Continuously, looking for challenges and striving to explore new domains and technologies. Having focus on code quality. Love to solve problems.
Have experience in converting monolithic to microservice-based applications. Directly worked with the customer support team to address the customer issues.

Certification:  Programming in C# (Exam 70-483), Scrum Master

Familiar Methodologies:  Agile (SCRUM)

Worked Project Types:  Monolithic and Microservice architecture, Cloud-based, Windows App (WinRT,
UWP), WPF, Web Projects, Windows Application, Windows service, Data analysis (ETL- export transport
and loading)

Used Technologies:  ASP.NET C#, Service Fabric, WinRT App, UWP App, WPF, ASP.Net MVC/Web API, Web
service, .Net Remoting, Reflection, JavaScript, jQuery

Used Database technologies:  SQL Server, SQL Compact, SQLite, MySQL

Used Azure technologies:  Service Fabric, ARM template, Logic App, Service Bus, Azure key vault, Blob storage, File storage,
Data Lake, Document DB, Table storage, Active Directory, Application insights web test, Application insights
availability test, Log Analytics.

Used Source Control:  Git repository, Visual Studio Team System,  Subversion, Visual Source Safe.

Languages Known:  English, Bengali, and Hindi.

projects:
[{'title': 'NaviPlanner', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'NaviPlanner: Application to keep vessels up to date with latest electronic navigational charts (ENC). Through NaviPlanner mariners can buy/update electronic navigational charts, plan voyage, optimize routes, get route suggestions and can share route. Exchange set can also be created to see the encs in ECDIS. 
 
NaviPlanner’s front end is a WPF based desktop application for on board systems and the backend is developed with microservice-based architecture using Azure service fabric. The backed is deployed in a Azure service fabric cluster. 
 
Remarkable Technologies: ASP.Net C#, WPF, Service fabric, Web API, Azure key vault, DocumentDB, Table storage, Blob storage,Sql Server, SQL compact, Logic App.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Md.
